_meanings:
{@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of the king Vatsa;  
{#prApyAvaMtInudayanakaTAkovidagrAmavfdDAn#}  
<ls>Me. 30.</ls> [A celebrated Prince of the lunar
race, who is usually styled Vatsarāja.
He reigned at Kauśāmbī. 
Vāsavadattā, Princess of Ujjayinī, saw
him in a dream and fell in love with
him. He was decoyed to that city
and there kept in prison by 
Chaṇḍamahāsena, the king. But on being released
by the minister he carried off 
Vāsavadattā from her father and a
rival suitor. Udayana is the hero of the
play called Ratnāvalī and his life has
been made the subject of several other
minor compositions. See Vatsa also].
